title: Coping & Support App for ADHD Women in Perimenopause

requirements.text: Create the core app information architecture and navigation for an app focused on ADHD women in perimenopause, with sections for: Home, Coping Toolkit, Topics/Library, Daily Check-in, Journal, and Saved/Favorites.

quotes: Create an app for ADHD women in perimonopause with help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: App has a clear primary navigation to Home, Coping Toolkit, Library, Daily Check-in, Journal, and Saved/Favorites.
Each section has an initial screen with readable English headings and short supportive copy appropriate for the target audience.
Navigation works end-to-end with no dead links.

requirements.text: Implement a coherent visual theme and design system for the app (colors, typography, spacing, components) with a calm, supportive style suitable for perimenopause + ADHD. Avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

quotes: Create an app for ADHD women in perimonopause with help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent palette, typography scale, and component styling across all screens.
Theme feels calm and readable (high contrast, comfortable line length, large tap targets).
Blue/purple are not used as the primary brand colors.

requirements.text: Build a Coping Toolkit feature that lets users browse coping mechanisms as cards and filter by category (e.g., Focus/Executive Function, Emotional Regulation, Sleep, Hot Flashes/Night Sweats, Brain Fog, Anxiety, Relationships, Work, Self-care).

quotes: help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: Toolkit displays a list/grid of coping mechanism cards with title, short summary, and category tags.
Users can filter by at least one category and see results update.
Selecting a card opens a detail view with steps and tips written in English.
Coping mechanisms are loaded from the backend and render consistently on refresh.

requirements.text: Create a Topics/Library section with short, structured educational content tailored to ADHD + perimenopause (e.g., hormones & attention, overwhelm loops, sensory sensitivity, sleep changes). Include a friendly disclaimer that the content is not medical advice.

quotes: app for ADHD women in perimonopause with help and ideas

acceptanceCriteria: Library lists multiple topics with title and short description.
Each topic has a readable detail page with headings and bullet points.
A visible disclaimer states content is informational and not medical advice.

requirements.text: Implement a Daily Check-in flow where users can quickly log today’s state using simple sliders/buttons (e.g., focus, mood, energy, sleep quality, hot flash severity, anxiety/irritability) and optional notes.

quotes: help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: Daily Check-in can be completed in under ~30 seconds (minimal required fields).
Check-ins are saved and can be viewed in a simple history list by date.
User can open a past check-in to view details.

requirements.text: Add a Journal feature for free-form entries with optional prompts relevant to the audience (e.g., ‘What felt hardest today?’, ‘What helped even a little?’, ‘What’s one kind thing I can do for myself?’).

quotes: help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: Users can create, view, and delete journal entries.
Journal supports optional prompt selection and free-form text.
Entries are associated with the signed-in user and persist across sessions.

requirements.text: Add Saved/Favorites so users can bookmark coping mechanisms and library topics and access them in one place.

quotes: help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: Each coping mechanism/topic can be saved/unsaved from its detail view.
Saved items appear in a Saved/Favorites section.
Saved state persists across refresh and across devices when the same user signs in.

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and ensure all user-specific data (check-ins, journal entries, saved items) is scoped to the authenticated user principal; allow read-only browsing of general content without sign-in.

quotes: Create an app for ADHD women in perimonopause with help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: User can sign in and sign out using Internet Identity.
Unauthenticated users can browse Library/Toolkit but cannot create check-ins/journal entries or save favorites (or they are prompted to sign in).
Authenticated users see their own check-ins/journal/saved items and not other users’ data.

requirements.text: Backend: define and expose Motoko actor methods to (1) list coping mechanisms and topics, and (2) CRUD user-specific records (check-ins, journal entries, saved items) with stable persistence.

quotes: Create an app for ADHD women in perimonopause with help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides query methods for listing coping mechanisms and topics.
Backend provides update methods for creating/deleting journal entries and creating/listing check-ins.
Backend provides methods to save/unsave and list saved items per user principal.
Data persists across canister upgrades using stable storage patterns; no cross-user data leakage occurs.

requirements.text: Add generated static illustrations and use them in the UI (e.g., on Home and empty states) from frontend/public/assets/generated, without routing images through the backend.

quotes: Create an app for ADHD women in perimonopause with help and ideas on coping mechanisms

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Home and at least one empty state screen displays one of the generated images.
App loads and renders images correctly in production build.

constraints: Backend must be implemented as a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor file).
Do not require or use external databases or third-party auth providers; only Internet Identity is allowed.
Do not implement real-time features (WebSockets) or push notifications.
nonGoals: Medical diagnosis or personalized medical treatment recommendations.
Crisis response, emergency services integration, or hotline calling features.
